summary: The Petronas Towers are two super-tall skyscrapers in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Standing at 451.9 meters (1,483 feet) tall, they were once the tallest buildings in the world from 1998 to 2004. Though now surpassed in height by other buildings, they remain the tallest twin skyscrapers globally. These iconic structures, connected at the base, are a prominent symbol of Kuala Lumpur and can be seen from various spots across the city.
title: Petronas Towers
